data.title: Our Firm – Flaherty & Crumrine
data.text:
Mr. Chadwick has managed preferred securities at Flaherty & Crumrine since 1999 and is a member of the firm’s portfolio management team. As one of the firm’s traders, he shares responsibility for implementing investment strategies. Mr. Chadwick is also involved in the development of tools for managing the portfolios and developing firm-wide systems. Together with Mr. Conwell and Mr. Stone, he serves on the firm’s board of directors and is a member of the executive management committee. He also serves as Chairman of the Board, Chief Executive Officer, and a Director of the Flaherty & Crumrine closed-end funds.

Prior to joining Flaherty & Crumrine in 1999, he worked at Koch Industries Inc. where he was responsible for managing sizable portfolios of both preferred securities and corporate bonds. He was also responsible for developing analytical tools used in the management of the portfolios, and providing fundamental research on a broad range of credits.

Mr. Stone joined Flaherty & Crumrine in 2003 after a 20-year career on Wall Street. Based in Summit, New Jersey, he is a member of the firm’s portfolio management team. He is responsible for macroeconomic and quantitative research and analysis and is co-head of the credit research group. Together with Mr. Chadwick and Mr. Conwell, he serves on the firm’s board of directors and is a member of the executive management committee. He also serves as Chief Financial Officer, Vice President and Treasurer of the U.S. Flaherty & Crumrine closed-end funds and oversees the financial reporting and tax operations for the Flaherty & Crumrine closed-end funds.

From 2001 until joining Flaherty & Crumrine, he was Director of U.S. Market Strategy at Barclays Capital in New York, where he advised clients on market strategies across U.S. treasuries, agencies, and interest rate derivative products. Prior to Barclays, he spent 14 years at Goldman Sachs, where he most recently held the position of Director — Interest Rate Product Strategy, Americas. He was a regular member of Institutional Investor’s All-America Fixed Income Research Team, earning the top ranking in Derivatives Strategy in 2001. He began his career at Salomon Brothers as an options trader and derivative salesperson.

Mr. Conwell joined Flaherty & Crumrine in 2005. Together with Mr. Chadwick and Mr. Stone, he serves on the firm’s board of directors and is a member of the executive management committee. He has responsibility in fund management, client servicing and marketing efforts. In addition, he is responsible for compliance and legal matters. Mr. Conwell also serves as Vice President, Secretary and Chief Compliance Officer of the Flaherty & Crumrine closed-end funds.

Previously, Mr. Conwell practiced at Paul, Hastings, Janofsky & Walker LLP, a global law firm, for more than six years in the areas of corporate finance and investment management regulation.

Ms. Tucci joined Flaherty & Crumrine in 2005. Ms. Tucci is co-head of the credit research group and is responsible for coverage of the utility, energy and foreign banking industries.

Prior to joining Flaherty & Crumrine, she spent five years as an Associate Director of Equity Research at UBS Investment Bank, where she covered natural gas pipelines and natural gas and electric utilities. Ms. Tucci was a member of the top-ranked Institutional Investor’s All-America Natural Gas Equity Research Team at UBS in 2003 and earned an honorable mention herself the same year.

Mr. Seto joined Flaherty & Crumrine in 2003 after spending eight years as an equity and fixed income analyst and eight years as a commercial bank lending officer. Mr. Seto is a member of the firm’s credit committee, where his focus is on global banks, REITs and industrials.

From 1999 until joining Flaherty & Crumrine, Mr. Seto was an Associate Equity Analyst at UBS Investment Bank, where he covered natural gas pipelines, local distribution companies, electric utilities, and master limited partnerships. Prior to UBS, he spent three years at Moody’s Investors Service as an Associate Analyst covering investment-grade Consumer Products and Retail companies. From 1991-1996, he was an AVP and commercial lending officer at NatWest Bank with primary account and cross-sell responsibilities for a portfolio of consumer products, consumer finance and retail companies. He was a member of the top-ranked Institutional Investor’s All-America Natural Gas Equity Research Team at UBS in 2003. He began his career at Heller Financial Inc. as a financial analyst in asset-based lending.

Mr. Russo has worked as a senior analyst covering investment grade and high yield corporate credits since 2000, primarily in the insurance and healthcare sectors. His prior experience includes manager of a team of analysts at an investment bank and as bank examiner for the U.S. Department of the Treasury. Mr. Russo began his career as a corporate accountant for a regional bank holding company.

Mr. Chen joined Flaherty & Crumrine in 2007. He is involved in market research, systems development, and client servicing.

Previously, he worked at Wedbush Morgan Securities in its equity research department while earning his M.B.A. degree. Prior to that, he spent 5 years in the software industry, first at an internet startup, Plumtree Software (now a part of Oracle Corporation), writing web portal applications and later at SPL Worldgroup (also now a part of Oracle Corporation) managing its web portal deployment.
